article: Almost everyone around us uses a phone. Phones provide a simple and efficient means to conduct work or _ social arrangements from day to day. Several times in course of a work day, you may be _ by phone with colleagues, students, lab assistants, secretaries or others on _ matters. If you want an appointment with your department head, you would _ call him and arrange a time with him. If you were unable to _ your appointment, or if you found you had to be late for it, you would phone and change the _ . In this way, no one _ time waiting for someone who is not coming. If you want to buy something, you would "let your _ do the walking". That is, you call _ to make sure the store has what you need. If it is an expensive item, you might call several stores to _ prices. If you want to take a train or plane, after finding out _ and prices, you can call to make a _ ; if you want to shop for clothes after work, you might call to ask how late the store is open _ you travel all way there. Phones are easily _ . In streets, you can see public phones in which you _ coins to make a call. Phones have _ answering services; if you are not at home or in the office, or don't wish to be _ , you switch on a machine, which will answer the call for you. A pre-recorded _ will say to the caller, "I'm _ , I'm not in at the moment. Please leave your name and number and I will call you back as _ as possible." It's mor efficient to leave one's name and number than to waste their time calling again and again.
